meanings.sent1: My estimate of how many jellybeans are in the jar was way off.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to make an estimate of the distance between two cities.
meanings.sent3: I made an estimate of how many cookies I could eat in one sitting, and it was too many.
meanings.sent4: Her estimate of the time it would take to finish the project was surprisingly accurate.
meanings.sent5: The estimate of the cost for the repair was higher than expected.

meanings.definition: To roughly calculate or guess the value, number, quantity, or extent of something.
meanings.sent1: I estimate that it will take us about an hour to reach the destination.
meanings.sent2: She estimated the number of balloons needed for the party to be around fifty.
meanings.sent3: The detective tried to estimate the height of the suspect based on the door frame.
meanings.sent4: He estimated the amount of paint required for the room by eyeing the walls.
meanings.sent5: The chef estimated the cooking time for the roast by the color of the meat.
